body: YOU wouldn't think it would be, but the traffic on the bridge is riveting. Sitting in the spare loft, which is all white and gray, one finds it impossible not to look, to watch the cars hurtling by. The occasional subway train seems lighter above ground, as if freed by some mysterious constraint imposed by life below. Like a huge canvas, the bridge
title: Habitats/Clock Tower Building in Brooklyn; To Dumbo, With Love

body: THE QE2 was docked at Casablanca in 1989 when Jeanie Bowers Scott, then performing on board as an opera singer, received a call from her husband, George. ''I bought a building for $13 million,'' he said, ''and when you get back we are moving in with a bunch of college students.'' The Scotts did indeed move into 521 West 49th Street with 176
title: A Niche Business: Dorms for New York Students

body: IN New York, many regular people -- meaning those who do not make hundreds of thousands of dollars a year -- do not think of landlords as being like them. title: Habitats / Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn; An Apartment Seeker Becomes a Landlord

body: To the Editor: The article ''SoHo, TriBeCa and Now Dumbo'' [Oct. 25] somehow omits the many social service agencies like the League Treatment Center that moved into the area before it was ''fashionable.'' title: 'SoHo, TriBeCa And Now Dumbo'

body: When the Brooklyn Academy of Music opens its new cinema tomorrow after four days of previews and a ribbon-cutting party tonight, a lot more will be riding on it than the mere fate of the borough's first art-house movie theater. title: More Than Just a Movie House; A Magnet for Brooklyn's Young Is in Place, but Will It Work?

body: The struggling gallery scene in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn is either reaching critical mass or is about to contract a serious case of nostalgia for ''the good old days.'' Maybe both. title: ART REVIEW; Brooklyn Haven For Art Heats Up

body: IT took David C. Walentas 17 years to win permission from New York City to begin the residential conversion of a muscular old industrial complex on the Brooklyn waterfront. With permission in hand, it took him only seven months to convert the first building, 1 Main Street, whose mansard-topped, four-faced clock tower holds its own as a skyline icon
title: SoHo, TriBeCa And Now Dumbo?

body: WHEN it comes to bridge designers practicing in the world today, there's the Spanish architect and engineer Santiago Calatrava and there's everyone else. Isn't that awful? title: ARCHITECTURE; Choosing Prose Over Poetry To Span a Bay

body: Dumbo Art Center 45 York Street Brooklyn Through Sept. 19 The 10-block area known as Dumbo (Down Under the Manhattan Bridge Overpass) is said to be home to some 500 artists. body: A 1915 warehouse overlooking the Brooklyn waterfront that had been used as an office building in the last decade is now being converted into condominium lofts, offering views of the East River and the Manhattan skyline. The $30 million conversion of the Clock Tower Building at One Main Street is the latest step in the slow transformation of the
title: RESIDENTIAL REAL ESTATE; A Neighborhood Called Dumbo Has High Hopes

body: The vision is clear: a lush green park along the Brooklyn waterfront. The challenge, as recent developments indicate, is to prevent that goal from drowning in process. title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: BROOKLYN WATERFRONT; One Park, Many Squabbles

body: It is ironic that Tierney chooses to refer to the Left Bank of Paris in bemoaning the ''decay'' of Brooklyn. In fact, Dumbo and other areas of the Brooklyn waterfront have for years been fulfilling the same need that the Rive Gauche did in its legendary heyday, providing a low-cost haven for students, artists and writers.
